executives.description: A chief executive officer, the highest-ranking person in a company or other institution, ultimately responsible for making managerial decisions.
The chief operating officer (COO) is responsible for executing and implementing the operational directives set by the CEO and the board of directors.

A chief financial officer, a senior executive with responsibility for the financial affairs of a corporation or other institution. The vice president of administration directs all administrative functions in line with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and company objectives.
Chief Information Officer, responsible for information technology and computer systems that support the organization's goals.

Responsible for the Consumer and Commercial Banking divisions, performing roles including lending, investing, risk management, marketing, and technology. Provides solutions to help retail customers meet their financial goals.
Responsible for the overall strategic marketing plans for the organization in order to attract potential customers and retain existing ones.

directors.description: Responsible for organizational development, recruitment, staffing, employment law, performance management, employee relations, and compensation and benefits.
Ensures the company conducts its business in compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, professional standards, and accepted business practices.
The senior executive managing legal affairs for the company.
Manages IT infrastructure, operations, and services, enabling businesses and individuals to access and use data and services.
Responsible for establishing and maintaining the security vision, strategy, and program to ensure information assets and technologies are adequately protected.
Responsible for analysis and reconciliation of accounts and development and implementation of accounting policies, procedures, and controls.
Responsible for identifying, assessing, and integrating physical security operations, technology, and policy solutions at the organization.
Responsible for overseeing facilities management to ensure efficient and safe operations.

managers.role: Manager, Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
managers.description: Develop, maintain, or implement business continuity and disaster recovery strategies and solutions, including risk assessments, business impact analyses, and documentation.
Performs full audits, including risk management, control management, and assessing financial reliability.
Designs and oversees the implementation of security measures for information systems, ensuring compliance with security policies.
Monitors, handles, and measures operational and economic risk exposures to minimize risk and implement controls.
Leads global procurement efforts to maximize value from suppliers and meet business objectives.

managers.role: Manager, Customer Experience and Community Engagement
managers.description: Fosters customer loyalty through high-quality interactions and improves overall customer experience.
Leads a sales team, providing guidance, training, mentorship, and creating sales plans and quotas.
Develops, implements, and executes strategic marketing plans to attract potential customers and retain existing ones.

managers.role: Manager, IT End User Service Desk
managers.description: Manages daily operations of the service desk and ensures the team is constantly developing and improving.
Delivers day-to-day support for end-user computing services organization-wide.
Responsible for daily operations of infrastructure, telecom, and support staff, ensuring service needs are met.

managers.role: Manager, Data Center and Hosting Services
managers.description: Oversees day-to-day operations of the datacenter, cloud services, and ensures high availability of data.
Identifies, assesses, and mitigates risks that could jeopardize the organization's assets, profitability, or existence.

specialists.description: Manages the lifecycle of unplanned interruptions, malfunctions, and quality reductions of IT services.
Acts as the first point of contact for customers experiencing technical issues, troubleshooting and providing support.
Provides expert IT advice and support to internal employees and manages escalation procedures for technical issues.
Maintains, troubleshoots, and administers LANs, WANs, mainframe networks, and peripheral equipment.
Monitors network infrastructure, documents procedures, and provides tier 2 and tier 3 technical support.
Protects IT infrastructure from breaches, detects threats, and takes necessary actions to resolve them.
Assists the Network Administrator in implementing and testing network solutions and updating devices.
Responsible for setting up, managing, and troubleshooting technology systems and providing end-user support.
